thread.title: Ohio State football hosts Western Michigan in final nonconference game: Buckeye Breakfast Gameday
thread.title_full: Ohio State football hosts Western Michigan in final nonconference game: Buckeye Breakfast Gameday | cleveland.com

author: Bill Landis, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Ohio State football hosts Western Michigan in final nonconference game: Buckeye Breakfast Gameday
text:
COLUMBUS, Ohio -- The Ohio State Buckeyes host the Western Michigan Broncos on Saturday in the final nonconference game of the 2015 season.
GAME INFORMATION
Who: Western Michigan Broncos (1-2) at No. 1 Ohio State Buckeyes (3-0)
When: Saturday, 3:30 p.m.
Where: Ohio Stadium
TV: ABC
Twitter: Follow Ari Wasserman , Bill Landis and Doug Lesmerises
Live chat: Join the cleveland.com conversation at 1:30 p.m.
Latest line: Ohio State -32.5
Series record: This will be the first meeting between Ohio State and Western Michigan.
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
Must-read links before kickoff:
• Urban Meyer's line on Monday was that Ohio State has been "playing defense on offense." The Buckeyes have been under-prepared and have looked stagnant the last two weeks. Meyer's fix? A more aggressive play calling style that's going to get the Buckeyes out of their funk.
• Lots of offensive questions this week, like: Is Ezekiel Elliott carrying the ball enough? Running backs coach Tony Alford had an answer.
• Is it possible that Western Michigan coach P.J. Fleck has a more difficult job assembling his team that Meyer does? If that sounds crazy, read this story by Ari Wasserman on the challenges of recruiting in the MAC. Maybe it is easier when you're Ohio State and selecting from the elite of the elite football prospects.
Urban Meyer say Cardale Jones will still start Urban Meyer said Cardale Jones will start on Saturday against Western Michigan.
• Meyer has named Cardale Jones his starting quarterback again this week , but has anything really changed? With the chance to definitively say Jones is the starter no matter what, Meyer instead left the door open for J.T. Barrett to play if Jones doesn't perform well.
• Doug answered some reader questions this week, including whether or not the Big Ten would ever play a nonconference series against the SEC.
• Take a look inside the phone call Ohio State defensive end Sam Hubbard made on the night before the season opener against Virginia Tech. Hubbard was nervous about his first game, so he reached out to mentor who also happens to be a former Meyer recruit from his Notre Dame days.
• 5 reasons Ohio State will win -- including Vonn Bell, the human silver bullet.
• 5 reasons Western Michigan will win -- including Fleck getting the chance Meyer never had.
GAME PICKS, OUTRAGEOUS PREDICTIONS
• Our outrageous predictions for Ohio State vs. Western Michigan , including another defensive touchdown and Ezekiel Elliott matching his season output for receptions.
• Check out our game picks for Saturday's game, one of us thinks Ohio State's offense gets back on track and has a big day.
THE B.A.D. OHIO STATE PODCAST
• Fame and college football was the theme of Episode 4 of the B.A.D. Ohio State Podcast. Does Ohio State have a Tim Tebow right now? Because the Buckeyes definitely have the most famous players in college football. Give the podcast a listen below.
Also, we have a SoundCloud page for the podcast that you can follow , and all of the cleveland.com sports podcasts are now on iTunes.
OHIO STATE STAT LEADERS
• Passing: Cardale Jones, 26-46, 334 yards, 2 TDs, 3 INTs
• R ushing: Ezekiel Elliott, 61 carries, 344 yards (5.4), 4 TDs
• Receiving: Curtis Samuel, 11 catches, 109 yards (9.9), 1 TD
• Tackles: Joshua Perry, 25
• Sacks: Tyquan Lewis, Darron Lee, Sam Hubbard, 2.5
• Interceptions: Tyvis Powell, Vonn Bell, Darron Lee, Gareon Conley, Eli Apple, 1
WESTERN MICHIGAN STAT LEADERS
• Passing: Zach Terrell, 82-116, 947 yards, 8 TDs, 5 INTs
• Rushing: Jarvion Franklin, 52 carries, 245 yards (4.7), 1 TD
• Receiving: Daniel Braverman, 40 catches, 398 yards (9.9), 3 TDs
• Tackles: Asantay Brown, 24
• Sacks: Caleb Bailey, 3
• Interceptions : Darius Phillips, 1
BIG TEN SCHEDULE
• Kansas at Rutgers, Noon (Big Ten Network)
• No. 22 BYU at Michigan, Noon (ABC)
• Central Michigan at No. 2 Michigan State, Noon (Big Ten Network)
• Southern Mississippi at Nebraska, Noon (ESPNEWS)
• Bowling Green at Purdue, Noon (Big Ten Network)
• Indiana at Wake Forest, 12:30 p.m. (ESPN3)
• Maryland at West Virginia, 3 p.m. (Fox Sports 1)
• North Texas at Iowa, 3:30 p.m. (ESPNU)
• Ohio at Minnesota, 3:30 p.m. (Big Ten Network)
• San Diego State at Penn State, 3:30 p.m. (Big Ten Network)
• Middle Tennessee at Illinois, 4 p.m. (ESPNEWS)
• Ball State at No. 17 Northwestern, 8 p.m. (Big Ten Network)
• Hawaii at No. 22 Wisconsin, 8 p.m. (Big Ten Network)
